div.div: This search form uses an instant search feature. As you type, search results will appear automatically below the search field. When you've entered you desired search terms use tab to navigate through the available results and hit enter to open the selected page or document.

div.p: DISTRICT 8 - TECH HELP Parents and Students... Got Chromebook issues? Password Problems? Connectivity Issues? Please click on the following link: DISTRICT 8 TECH HELP Then follow these...
DISTRICT 8 STUDENTS Having trouble with that math problem? Struggling with a Social Studies or Science Question? Need some help with those vocabulary and spelling words? Have no fear! We have...
Coronavirus (COVID-19) has arrived in North Dakota. WCSD8 is monitoring the situation closely and participating in discussions with Governor Burgum, ND Dept. of Health and ND Dept of Instruction....

Dear Hawk Family,
How are you doing? D8 recognizes this is a very stressful time for families so I wanted to reach out and remind you that the school does have resources for students who may need them.
Teachers are noticing stress in students and we would like to encourage all parents to sit down with each child in your household individually and ask how they are doing.
Here is a link to "How to talk to your kids about CoVID" if you go to this link and scroll down quite a bit there is a "Mental Health" section which includes warning signs to watch for regarding your child's mental health.
Learning is important, but your child's health and well-being are our primary concern. Attendance is really important so that teachers can check in with kids and kids can see each other. Please keep encouraging kids to login. Don't worry about grades, let your child know that we just want them to try and we want to see them because we care.
If your child is stressed about "failing," please assure them that we are working hard to figure out ways that we can help ALL kids get caught up.
If you have any questions, need to talk or you think your child needs mental health assistance, please contact any of the following. . . School Counselor Reichman, nerida.reichman@k12.nd.us Principal Smith, robert.c.smith@k12.nd.us Principal Guglich, steven.guglich@k12.nd.us Superintendent Zietz, beth.zietz@k12.nd.us Principal Morey, michaela.morey@k12.nd.us
Your child's teacher would also be a good source if your child is struggling.
Stay safe, stay well, and know that we care,
Supt. Zietz
Hawk Parents/Guardians and Students, please provide District 8 with feedback regarding our CoVID-19 response by filling out this survey. . .https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/DFQWF8D

Williams County Public Schools provides equal opportunity in its programs, activities, and employment. If you cannot fully access the information on any web page of this site, please let us know the accessibility issue you are having by contacting Steve Guglich, Technology Director, at (701) 572-6359 or by e-mail at steven.guglich@k12.nd.us. We will try to provide the information to you in an alternate format and/or make the necessary improvements to make the information accessible. If you would like to file a formal grievance under Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act or Title II of the Americans with Disabilities Act, you may contact our Section 504/Title II coordinator, Nerida Reichman, at 111 7th Avenue West, Williston, ND 58801, at (701) 572-6359, or by e-mail at nerida.reichman1@k12.nd.us.
